intro: Turraea obtusifolia var. matopensis, commonly known as the Matopos turraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody, shrub-like structure. The plant features elliptical, dark green leaves with a leathery texture and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in rocky or dry habitats, adapting well to arid conditions. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a component of local flora and its potential ecological value in its native range.
